Bethel CCCU Employee Scholarship

Up to $1,200 per year ($400 per semester) for select students in our Ed.D. program.

Amount

$400 per semester (maximum $1,200 per year).

Renewal

Must reapply each year.

Eligibility

Students who enroll at least half time (3 credits/semester) in the Doctor of Education Leadership in Higher Education program at Bethel. Student must be an employee of a CCCU school. Recipients do not need to demonstrate need and are not eligible for other Bethel-funded grants or scholarships. Students already receiving gift assistance from any source (including military benefits and employer tuition reimbursement) that fully meets tuition are not eligible for this scholarship. Recipients of this scholarship are not eligible for other Bethel-funded grants or scholarships.

Academic requirements

Must be enrolled in Bethel's Ed.D. in Leadership in Higher Education program.

How to apply

Complete the appropriate application and submit it to the Office of Financial Aid prior to the start of your first class.

For Fall of 2017 through Summer of 2018 complete this form 2017-2018 (pdf)

For Fall of 2017 through Summer of 2019, complete this form 2018-2019 (pdf)

Undergrad

For recent high school grads and transfer students looking for an outstanding liberal arts education within a vibrant Christian community.

  • Apply now
  • Visit campus
  • Request info
  • Financial aid

Adult Undergrad

For working adults of all ages, experience levels, and backgrounds who want to complete their undergraduate degree or start their college education.

  • Apply now
  • Request info
  • Financial aid

Graduate

For professionals interested in earning advanced degrees that will move them forward in their careers and allow them to grow as leaders.

  • Apply now
  • Request info
  • Financial aid

Seminary

For men and women, of all ages, who sense a calling to ministry—youth, urban, rural, cross-cultural, and a growing range of unconventional settings.

  • Apply
  • Request Information
  • Financial Aid

Why Bethel?

Higher learning that's transformational—that's the Bethel University difference. We’re not only an academically rigorous university, we’re also a Christian community where faculty, coaches, staff, and students push one another to become better scholars, leaders, and servants in our communities.

Read more about the distinct advantages of Bethel, for all of our students.
